Sentencas: Dry reforming of methane at low temperatures of 400 ~ 700 degrees C is examined by using conventional Ni/Al2O3 catalyst and spinel-derived Ni catalyst anchored on aluminum oxide through powder-based solid-state reaction.
Titulo: Enhancement of surface morphology and catalytic kinetics of NiAl2O4 spinel-derived Ni catalyst to promote dry reforming of methane at low temperature for the direct application to a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The spinel-derived Ni catalyst exhibits uniform particle distribution with a size of 10 nm (10 times smaller than the conventional Ni/Al2O3 catalyst) and the highest catalytic performance under all operating conditions with apparent activation energies of 42.51 kJ/mol for CH4 conversion and 45.39 kJ/mol for CO2 conversion.
Titulo: Enhancement of surface morphology and catalytic kinetics of NiAl2O4 spinel-derived Ni catalyst to promote dry reforming of methane at low temperature for the direct application to a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Kinetics analysis elucidates that the conventional Ni/Al2O3 catalyst changes its rate-limiting factor from diffusion limitation to kinetics limitation with decreasing temperature near 550 degrees C.
Titulo: Enhancement of surface morphology and catalytic kinetics of NiAl2O4 spinel-derived Ni catalyst to promote dry reforming of methane at low temperature for the direct application to a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: In contrast, the spinel-derived Ni catalyst has a single rate-limiting factor of diffusion limitation at all temperatures avoiding surface kinetics limitation.
Titulo: Enhancement of surface morphology and catalytic kinetics of NiAl2O4 spinel-derived Ni catalyst to promote dry reforming of methane at low temperature for the direct application to a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: In addition, it is shown that the spinel-derived Ni catalyst exhibits better stability than the conventional Ni/Al2O3 catalyst, attributed to the enhanced interaction between active Ni particles and Al2O3 support.
Titulo: Enhancement of surface morphology and catalytic kinetics of NiAl2O4 spinel-derived Ni catalyst to promote dry reforming of methane at low temperature for the direct application to a solid oxide fuel cell
